meanings.definition: To make accustomed or used to something
meanings.sent1: She is habituating her puppy to the sound of the doorbell.
meanings.sent2: The students are habituating to the new school schedule.
meanings.sent3: The cat is habituating to wearing a tiny hat for fun.
meanings.sent4: The plant is habituating to the sunny spot by the window.
meanings.sent5: He is habituating to the early morning jogging routine.

meanings.sent1: The baby is habituating to sleeping through the night.
meanings.sent2: Over time, she is habituating to the cold weather.
meanings.sent3: The robot is habituating to making pancakes perfectly every time.
meanings.sent4: The athlete is habituating to the pressure of competing at a high level.
meanings.sent5: The bird is habituating to the freedom of flying in the open sky.
